lines.text:
[reading]
To my darling brother-in-law, a sock for your foot and a sock for your jaw.

[reading]
To my mother-in-law, a candid song. Why don't you go home where you belong?

[His doctor is leaving in disgust after being called a "pill peddler" by Edgar. He vows never to come back again]
Say, doc, can I DEPEND on that?

[Edgar wakes up, thinking he's already dead when in fact, he has taken a sleeping pill and has become part of a joke/lesson sprung on him by his brother-in-law]
And I thought I was going to Heaven!
